ovdesc.p: This application allows a rounding rule to be set at application level instead of the currency level. This rounding rule ignores the one defined at the currency level provided a rounding rule has been defined for the calling application.

The rounding rule id in the application record is the key to the EB.ROUNDING.RULE to be used. i.e.Any transaction from an application which has a defined rounding rule, will use the rounding as set up here, irrespective of the currency of the transaction.
Note only the two settings below will overrule the rounding definition at the currency level are:
ROUNDING.TYPE : this will ignore the definition in the fields MIN.ROUND.TYPE and CASH.ROUND.TYPE in the Currency record.
USE.MIN.UNIT: It will indicate whether the MIN.ROUND.AMOUNT defined in the currency will be used.
Otherwise the rest of the rounding definition is used from the Currency record

desc.p: This defines the types of rounding that are used by the rounding rule.
This overrules the setting under MIN.ROUND.TYPE and CASH.ROUND.TYPE in the Currency record.
The possible values are: 1, 2, 3, CURRENCY and NONE
Depending on how USE.MIN.UNIT is set, either the NO.OF.DECIMAL.PLACES or MIN.ROUND.AMOUNT from the Currency record is used for the following round types:
If set to ‘1’, then the natural rounding applies
If set to ‘2’, then rounding down applies
If set to ‘3’, then rounding up applies
However if set to ‘NONE’ , then a natural rounding to decimal places is applied.
If set to ‘CURRENCY’ then, the rounding rule as defined at the Currency level is applied and the rest of the definition in the rounding rule is ignored.
This defines whether the minimum amount, or the lowest unit of currency, is to be used when rounding is in effect for the currency.
This field is intended for use when the minimum rounding amount is not always the same as the lowest unit of currency defined by NO.OF.DECIMALS.
Rounding of amounts to this minimum unit is performed according to whatever choice dictated in the ROUNDING.TYPE
· The Possible values are (blank, ‘Y’ or ‘NO)
· If this field is blank or set to ‘NO’, then the number of decimals set at Currency level will be used.
If set to ‘Y’, then if a MIN.ROUND.AMOUNT is set at the Currency level , this is used, otherwise the number of decimals at the Currency level is used

Setup to do a pre rounding of 6 Decimal points before applying actual rounding rule. Setting this field to NO will make the system to apply rounding for the Actual amount without applying any pre rounding.

p.p: Valid inputs are NO or Blank.
Default is Blank which will apply the initial rounding of 6 Decimal points.

desc.p: This describes the Rounding rule.
· Mandatory field
· Minimum of 3 characters and Up to 20 characters.
An alphanumeric value of minimum 3 characters and maximum of 35 characters for the ID.
